description: NSE and nine former senior executives, including ex-MD Vikram Limaye, settled a case with Sebi for Rs 643 crore over allegations of brokers bypassing a trading access point to facilitate faster trades. Alongside the settlement, eight officials are required to perform 14 days of pro bono community service. This is Sebi's largest settlement in its 36-year history.
title: NSE, ex-MD settle case with Sebi for Rs 643 crore

description: Amid rising global conflicts in Ukraine and West Asia, PM Narendra Modi voiced optimism about the Indian economy, highlighting decade-long transformative changes. Speaking at the Kautilya Economic Conclave, he noted global confidence in India's growth, citing upgraded projections by the World Bank, IMF, and Moody's. Modi emphasized ongoing reforms and potential investment opportunities, particularly in the green economy.
title: Despite conflicts, world upbeat on Indian era: PM Modi
Illegitimate son eligible for compassionate employment: HC

description: India is projected to nearly double its per capita income in the next five years, driven by government reforms, dynamic geopolitical changes, and strong growth in consumption, innovation, and a robust financial system. However, challenges such as geopolitical risks and economic impacts from new technologies remain critical.
title: Per capita income to nearly double in 5 years: Sitharaman

description: Indian Foreign Minister S Jaishankar is set to visit Pakistan for the first time in nine years to attend the SCO heads of government meeting in Islamabad on October 15-16. This visit, although bound by the SCO summit context, raises prospects of re-engaging at a high diplomatic level amid strained relations since August 2019.
title: Not much should be read into minister's Pakistan trip: MEA

description: The Kerala High Court found seven IUML workers guilty of murdering DYFI activist Shibin in 2015, overturning their earlier acquittal. Shibin's death and injuries to six CPM workers were due to political and communal rivalry. Sentencing is scheduled for October 15.
title: 8 Muslim League workers held guilty in 2015 killing of CPM man

description: Supreme Court declined an immediate halt to demolition of Muslim properties near Somnath temple. Gujarat govt justifies actions as lawful encroachment removal. If contempt of SC's Sept 17 order is proven, reconstruction will be ordered. Next hearing on Oct 16.
title: Top court declines to halt demolitions near Somnath

description: Yasin Malik, chairman of Jammu & Kashmir Liberation Front-Yasin (JKLF-Y), declared in an affidavit that he renounced armed struggle for a peaceful resolution of the Kashmir issue in 1994, opting for a 'Gandhian way of resistance.' Despite his claims of engaging with central government officials for dialogue, JKLF-Y remains banned for five more years.
title: Have quit 'armed struggle' in 1984, turned Gandhian: Yasin Malik

description: Rajasthan's home department plans to replace Urdu and Persian terms in police records with Hindi or English alternatives, citing comprehension issues for new recruits and the public. This change aims to reduce communication errors. Home minister Bedham mentions PM Modi's prior suggestion to use more accessible language in official documentation.
title: Urdu is complex, phase it out of police parlance, says Raj mantri

description: A peacock has been sighted in Bageshwar's Himalayan region, far above its usual lower-altitude habitat, suggesting possible climate change effects. Wildlife experts investigate this anomaly, noting that shifts in weather patterns may be altering animal migration and leading species to new territories.
title: Peacock seen at 6,500 feet, likely sign of climate change, say experts

description: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq asserts dialogue as the sole resolution for the Kashmir issue, criticizing the effectiveness of elections and violence. He underscores the longstanding political dispute and the need for genuine efforts toward peace, urging the Indian government for meaningful talks.
title: Polls no solution to Kashmir issue, talks only way forward: Mirwaiz Umar

description: In response to China's enhanced air combat capabilities along the frontier, the Indian Air Force is upgrading its airbases and expediting the delivery of Tejas fighters. Despite technological lags, the IAF emphasizes training to maintain combat readiness, with plans to boost indigenous production and infrastructure development.
title: China outpacing India in technology, defence production & infrastructure, says IAF chief

description: Opposition parties in Jammu and Kashmir have criticized the BJP's move to nominate five MLAs before forming the government. This would increase the legislative assembly size and potentially manipulate the majority. Congress deems this action anti-democratic and manipulative of the people's mandate.
title: Will 5 J&K MLAs be nominated before result? Opposition cries foul

description: Foreign minister Jaishankar's upcoming visit to Pakistan for the SCO summit marks a rare and significant high-level engagement amidst strained India-Pakistan ties. This move signals India's intent to stabilize relations and hopes for fruitful bilateral discussions, especially around trade ties and diplomatic exchanges.
title: Not much should be read into minister's Pakistan trip: MEA

description: Sri Lankan President Dissanayake assured India's foreign minister, S Jaishankar, that Sri Lanka will not allow its territory to threaten India's security. They emphasized the intertwined security and economic interests of both nations. Dissanayake highlighted renewable energy exports and tourism potentials. India pledged $61.5 million for port modernization and promised development assistance, including 22 locomotives for Sri Lankan railways.
title: Will not allow anti-India acts on our soil: Sri Lanka president

description: India's forex reserves hit an all-time high of $704.8 billion, driven by a surge in foreign assets and gold reserves. This milestone makes India the fourth country to achieve such reserves, highlighting robust capital flows and the effective tenure of RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das.
title: Forex kitty hits $700 billion for 1st time, up $13 billion in week

description: Shoppers favored mobile phones and electronics in the initial week of online festive sales, with platforms like Amazon and Flipkart achieving over Rs 54,500 crore in sales, a 26% increase year-on-year. High-end smartphones, including iPhone 15 and Samsung's Galaxy S23 FE, were popular. Premium consumer durables also saw significant demand, especially via EMI purchases in smaller cities.
title: Mobiles, smart appliances top festive e-shopping list

description: Two women mountaineers from the USA and UK have been missing for over 36 hours at an altitude of 6,500m near Chaukhamba-III Peak in Chamoli district. Their critical supplies were lost in a gorge. Despite efforts, the Indian Air Force's helicopters haven't yet located them.
title: 2 US & UK climbers lose equipment, go missing in Uttarakhand

description: In UP's Amethi, a govt school teacher, his wife, and their two daughters were killed by Chandan Verma, an allegedly jealous lover. Verma, who is on the run, had posted a WhatsApp status indicating his intent. The family had filed a complaint against him in August.
title: 'Today 5 people will die,' posted 'killer' before wiping out family

description: Supreme Court restrained the UP government from taking coercive action against journalist Abhishek Upadhyaya for publishing an article with a casteist tilt. Emphasizing the protection of journalists' rights under Article 19(1)(a), the court highlighted that criticizing the government should not lead to criminal prosecution.
title: Criticism of government no ground for criminal case against scribe: SC

description: The House of Saud is the world’s richest family with over $1.4 trillion. Their wealth primarily comes from vast oil reserves. Led by King Salman, the family's luxurious lifestyle includes grand palaces, extravagant yachts, private jets, and a valuable art collection. The Al Sabah family of Kuwait and Qatar's House of Thani are also among the top wealthy families.
title: This world’s richest family surpassing billionaires' net worth

description: The Steelers face a crucial decision as Justin Fields and Russell Wilson compete for the starting quarterback role. Fields' impressive performance has drawn praise, but Wilson's return from injury stirs debates among fans and experts. With a key game against the Cowboys looming, coaches must decide whether to stick with Fields or revert to Wilson.
title: Ryan Clark calls on Arthur Smith to free Justin Fields against Cowboys

description: The Supreme Court has ordered an independent SIT, including officers from CBI, Andhra Pradesh Police, and FSSAI, to investigate allegations of adulteration in the Tirupati laddu prasadam. This decision follows multiple PILs and seeks to ensure an unbiased probe, stressing the potential impact on the sentiments of millions of devotees.
title: SC constitutes new SIT to probe Tirupati laddu row

description: Makhtar Diop, managing director of IFC, plans to expand India's focus to include blue bonds for water and support municipalities in raising funds. He highlights the strong growth in India's IFC portfolio and aims to continue annual investments of $4-5 billion while addressing job creation, energy transition, and financial sector improvements.
title: Ready with blue investments for sustainable marine economy: IFC chief

description: Due to the ongoing Israel-Iran conflict, flights are avoiding airspace in Israel, Iran, Iraq, and Jordan. However, GPS spoofing is causing confusion with flight tracking systems showing incorrect routes. Airlines, including Lufthansa, are using alternative navigation methods to ensure safety and proper routing.
title: Still overflying Israel? GPS spoofing showing wrong flights routings cause concern

description: India faltered in their crucial Women's T20 World Cup opener as New Zealand, led by Sophie Devine's unbeaten 57, secured a commanding 58-run win. Devine's tactical acumen and New Zealand's effective use of slow bowlers dismantled India's line-up in 161 chase, highlighting significant gaps in execution.
title: Women's T20 WC: All-round NZ thrash India by 58 runs

description: During the India vs New Zealand Women's T20 World Cup match, a controversial decision denied India's captain Harmanpreet Kaur a run out, causing heated discussions and visible frustration. The umpires ruled the ball dead, leading to debates between the Indian coach and the fourth umpire.
title: Harmanpreet unconvinced by Amelia Kerr's run-out decision

description: Fans eagerly anticipate The Rock's WWE return at Bad Blood 2024 in Georgia, particularly after his Instagram post confirming his presence in the city. Speculations are rife about his role, possibly aligning with Roman Reigns, Solo Sikoa, or reigniting his feud with Cody Rhodes. The event kicks off at 3pm ET on Saturday, October 5.
title: The Rock fuels WWE bad blood rumors after presence confirmation in Georgia

description: During the T20 World Cup 2024 match in Dubai, New Zealand batter Amelia Kerr was controversially declared not out after India's Harmanpreet Kaur attempted a run-out. Despite Kerr being short of her crease, the on-field umpires ruled it a dead ball as the end of the over had been signalled. This led to significant protests from the Indian team.
title: Run-out row! Why Kerr was given not out by umpires

description: Swiggy has introduced Bolt, a 10-minute meal and beverage delivery service, in key locations including Hyderabad, Mumbai, Delhi, Pune, Chennai, and Bangalore. By partnering with nearby restaurants, it aims to deliver popular dishes and ready-to-pack items swiftly. The service will expand to more locations soon, ensuring delivery partners face no penalties for delivery times.
title: Swiggy Bolt: Food delivery platform launches 10-minute meal delivery service

description: A political controversy has erupted over disaster aid, with MAGA Trump supporters accusing Kamala Harris of diverting funds meant for hurricane victims to illegal immigrants and foreign wars. Prominent figures like Trump, Eric Trump, and Elon Musk are leading these charges, despite counterclaims of misinformation and political manipulation.
title: MAGA storm over hurricane relief puts immigrants in crosshairs

description: A year on from the October 7 Hamas attacks, Israel remains devastated. Over 60 Israeli soldiers were killed and many captured at the Nahal Oz military base. Soldiers had noticed suspicious activities prior, but the military's response was inadequate. Questions arise about preparedness and response delays. The IDF is investigating, leaving survivors and families searching for answers and accountability.
title: When Israel was caught off guard: How Hamas overran key base on Oct 7

description: Haryana voters head to the polls on Saturday, with 1,031 candidates competing for 90 assembly seats. Over 20,600 polling booths have been prepared to accommodate more than 20 million eligible voters. The main contenders include the BJP, Congress, AAP, and an alliance between JJP and ASP. The counting of the votes will be done on October 8,  along with the Jammu and Kashmir, where elections were held after 10 years. ​​
title: BJP eyes hat-trick, Congress a comeback as Haryana votes tomorrow

description: The central government expressed disappointment and condemnation over Islamic preacher Zakir Naik's visit to Pakistan, where he was warmly welcomed. Naik, wanted in India for hate speech and terror-related charges, is set to deliver lectures across major Pakistani cities, highlighting his controversial background and ongoing legal issues. Naik, 58, is the founder of the Islamic Research Foundation (IRF). A doctor by profession, he is known for delivering inflammatory lectures in English, unlike many other Islamic preachers who use Urdu or Arabic.
title: 'Disappointing, condemnable but not ... ': India on fugitive Zakir Naik's Pakistan visit

description: Kamala Harris’s estrangement from her father, Donald J. Harris, stems from complex family dynamics dating back to her parents’ separation when she was a child. Despite their proximity in Washington, they have been distant for years, with personality similarities, ambition, and past conflicts contributing to the rift. Kamala’s close relationship with her mother and Donald’s absence at key life events deepened the divide. While he remains proud of her achievements, the potential for reconciliation exists, though neither has actively pursued it.
title: Why Harris and her father Donald don’t talk despite living 2 miles apart

description: India has not initiated an evacuation process from Israel, Iran, and other Middle Eastern countries amid ongoing tensions, but flights remain available for those wishing to return. The Indian government emphasises restraint and civilian protection, and seeks to prevent a wider regional conflict.
title: 'No evacuation process yet but if ...': MEA amid Middle-East tensions

description: Abhimanyu Easwaran's dismissal for 191 in the Irani Cup 2024 against Mumbai was a key moment on the fourth day at Ekana Cricket Stadium, Lucknow. His crucial 165-run partnership with Dhruv Jurel helped Rest of India reach a substantial total of 416. Mumbai now leads by over 250 runs, setting up a tense final day.
title: Watch: Easwaran's reaction after getting dismissed for 191

description: Amid rumours of a rift in Haryana Congress, Rajya Sabha MP Kumari Selja affirms her candidacy for the chief minister's post if the party wins the upcoming elections, citing her seniority and contributions. She dismisses speculations of joining the BJP.
title: 'Nazarandaaz toh nahi karenge': Kumari Selja on Congress' Haryana CM pick

description: Former Indian cricketer Mohammad Kaif supports a new IPL rule change that allows MS Dhoni to play as an uncapped player beyond 2024, despite his last appearance for India in 2019. Kaif highlights Dhoni's influence and fitness, while emphasizing that financial aspects don't concern Dhoni, making this rule change significant for both him and CSK.
title: ‘Everyone knows IPL rule changed for Dhoni’: Kaif

description: Aaryavir Sehwag, son of legendary Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag, made a notable debut in the Vinoo Mankad Trophy, scoring 49 runs to help Delhi secure a six-wicket win against Manipur. His performance included a crucial 61-run stand with skipper Pranav Pant, who remained unbeaten on 75 off 45 balls, enhancing his cricketing credentials.
title: Sehwag’s son Aaryavir makes impressive debut for Delhi

description: Passengers on a Muscat-bound Air India Express flight were safely evacuated after smoke was detected just before takeoff. All 142 passengers received food and beverages at the terminal, and an alternative flight was arranged. The departure was delayed due to a scheduled runway closure. An investigation into the cause is underway.
title: Passengers evacuated after smoke detected on Air India Express flight

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized India's rapid economic growth, highlighting Rs 1.25 lakh crore investments under PLI schemes, ongoing advancements in AI and semiconductor industries, and improvements in the Global Innovation Index. He affirmed confidence in sustaining over 7% growth despite global uncertainties.
title: 'India got Rs 1.25L cr investments under PLI, will deliver Made in India chips': PM Modi

description: Salil Ankola's mother, Mala Ankola, was found dead with neck injuries at her home in Pune. Police are investigating whether her death was a murder or suicide, as there were no signs of forced entry. Mala Ankola was 77 years old.
title: Reports: Bigg Boss contestant Salil Ankola's mother Mala Ankola killed in Pune

description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's visit to Sri Lanka focuses on enhancing economic recovery efforts, strengthening cooperation in tourism, energy, and investment. He meets Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya, and Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath to reaffirm India's support and discuss key collaboration areas.
title: Jaishankar reaffirms India's support for Sri Lanka's economic recovery

description: The intense India vs Australia Test cricket rivalry is highlighted by sledging, especially from India's Rishabh Pant. Australian players unanimously recognize Pant as the primary sledger and banterer. The upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy begins November 22, with India aiming to secure their position in the World Test Championship final.
title: Aussie players unanimously name Pant as India's top sledger
Mumbai: Woman files gangrape plaint, then goes missing

description: Before Meghan's wedding, she reached out to Victoria for advice of best facials and hairdresser in London. But the story was leaked to the UK Sun. Since Meghan did not leak it to the press, it was presumably Victoria and Harry was asked to complain to David. The Beckhams denied any leak but Harry and Meghan became distrustful of them.
title: Meghan, Harry completely ditched by David and Victoria Beckham?

description: Tamil Nadu deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin responded cryptically to Andhra Pradesh deputy CM Pawan Kalyan's warning against those opposing 'Sanatana Dharma'. Kalyan suggested creating a 'Sanatana Dharma Protection Board' and implementing certification measures. Stalin had previously sparked controversy by comparing 'Sanatana Dharma' to diseases, later clarifying his comments were against its divisive nature.
title: 'Let's wait & see': Udhayanidhi Stalin on Pawan Kalyan's Sanatana Dharma remarks

description: Alice Kaushik, a Delhi-born actress and Delhi University graduate, first gained fame with Suryaputra Karna. She later impressed audiences with roles in Kahaan Hum Kahaan Tum and Pandya Store. She is now confirmed for Bigg Boss 18 and is dating co-star Kanwar Dhillon.
title: All you need to know about Bigg Boss 18 contestant Alice Kaushik

description: Former Pakistan wicketkeeper Kamran Akmal lauds India head coach Gautam Gambhir as a 'brother' and praises MS Dhoni's calm demeanour and stellar career. Akmal congratulates Gambhir on his recent success, winning his first Test series as a coach against Bangladesh. Gambhir's dedication is highlighted by his visit to the Maa Pitambara Temple during Shardiya Navratri.
title: 'Gambhir is like my brother': Kamran Akmal

description: Liz Cheney, a conservative Republican, and Kamala Harris, the liberal vice president, jointly criticized Donald Trump and his MAGA movement in a pivotal event in Wisconsin. Cheney highlighted Trump's flaws, supporting Harris as the patriotic choice. Harris emphasized unity across parties to protect US democracy, with Obama set to boost her campaign.
title: Will Liz Cheney be Kamala's trump card?

description: Pawan Khera, from the All India Congress Committee, highlighted Rahul Gandhi's efforts in his first 100 days as Lok Sabha's opposition leader. Gandhi addressed issues affecting farmers, laborers, and manual scavengers, and opposed government malpractices. He also demanded a fair recruitment process in the Army and stood against the Broadcast Bill aimed at curbing media independence.
title: Report card of Rahul's 100 days as leader of opposition courtesy Cong

description: During the India vs New Zealand Women's T20 World Cup match, a controversial decision denied India's captain Harmanpreet Kaur a run out, causing heated discussions and visible frustration. The umpires ruled the ball dead, leading to debates between the Indian coach and the fourth umpire.
title: Harmanpreet unconvinced by Amelia Kerr's run-out decision

description: Group Captain Angad Pratap talks about the evolving diversity in India’s human spaceflight programme, emphasizing science over personal glory. ISRO seeks candidates with expertise in experimental domains and aerospace research. The Gaganyaan training is comprehensive, covering academics, physical fitness, and survival skills, preparing astronauts for future space missions.
title: Seek science milestones, not personal glory: Gaganyaan astronaut Angad Pratap

description: Govinda, who recently made headlines for accidentally shooting himself (on the left leg) with a loaded revolver, finally shared details about how he injured his leg during a recent press conference, shortly after being discharged from the hospital today (October 4).
title: 'I'm a bit ... ': Actor Govinda breaks silence on accidental shooting

description: Protesting junior doctors in Kolkata ended their strike demanding better safety at medical facilities. They issued a 24-hour ultimatum to the government for their demands, threatening an indefinite hunger strike. The strike followed the rape and murder of a trainee doctor. Despite government assurances, doctors claim little action has been taken.
title: With 24-hr ultimatum to Mamata govt, protesting docs end 'total cease work'

description: The European Court of Justice ruled that EU countries can grant asylum to Afghan women solely based on nationality and gender due to severe Taliban-imposed restrictions. This decision stems from a case involving two Afghan women denied refugee status in Austria. The court emphasized that such measures constitute persecution, making specific proof of individual harm unnecessary.
title: Nationality enough for Afghan women to seek asylum, rules EU court

description: At least 28 suspected Naxalites have been killed in a fierce encounter with security forces in Narayanpur district. The gunfight erupted in Abujhmarh forests near Thulthuli village. Security forces from Dantewada and Narayanpur were involved. Automatic weapons and explosives were recovered. The encounter is part of heightened anti-Naxal operations in the Bastar region.
title: Security personnel gun down 28 Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Bastar region

description: Customs officials at Delhi’s IGI Airport seized a total of 38 iPhone 16 Pro Max smartphones from two separate incidents involving passengers arriving from Dubai and Hong Kong. The latest, most expensive Apple phones, launched last month, are cheaper in Dubai and Hong Kong, prompting smuggling attempts.
title: Customs at Delhi Airport seize 12 iPhone 16 Pro Max from 4 passengers

description: Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh highlights rapid infrastructure development along the LAC by China, especially in Ladakh, and stresses the need for India's self-reliance in weapon systems by 2047. He emphasizes the importance of domestic manufacturing to avoid supply chain disruptions in conflict situations, underscoring recent troop disengagements in Eastern Ladakh.
title: 'China rapidly building infrastructure along LAC': IAF chief Amar Preet Singh

description: A shocking Instagram post featuring a 17-year-old boy with a country-made gun led Delhi Police to apprehend him for murdering Yunani doctor Javed Akhtar. The 50-year-old was shot dead by two teenagers, one of whom was influenced by the nurse’s husband suspecting an affair.
title: 'First murder in 2024': Teen boasted Delhi doc's killing in chilling Instagram post

description: On October 4, 2024, Nadiadwala Grandson Entertainment announced 'Kick 2' via Instagram, sharing a photo of Salman Khan from the photoshoot.The caption read:"It was a great Kick 2 photo shoot Sikandar….!!! From Grand Sajid Nadiadwala @beingsalmankhan @wardakhannadiadwala #Kick2 #Sikandar." This post has generated considerable buzz on social media, with fans expressing their eagerness for the sequel.
title: Kick 2: Sajid Nadiadwala drops Salman Khan's first picture from the photoshoot

description: The Bombay High Court resolved a dispute between Zee Entertainment and the CBFC regarding the film "Emergency." The CBFC required 13 changes to issue a UA certificate, and Zee confirmed compliance. The court allowed 30 days for modifications, followed by 14 days for CBFC verification. The film, starring Kangana Ranaut, attracted Sikh group protests.
title: Relief for Kangana Ranaut as HC disposes of plea on 'Emergency' release

description: A couple in Kanpur, running a therapy center called Revival World, scammed over two dozen couples by promising a time machine to reverse aging, defrauding them of Rs 35 crore. They exploited insecurities about aging and health by offering costly oxygen therapy sessions and turning the scam into a pyramid scheme.
title: Rs 35 crore Israeli ‘time machine’ scam: UP couple cons people with age-reversal fantasy

description: Three Bengaluru colleges, including BIT, BMSCE, and MSRIT, received bomb threats prompting bomb disposal squads to act. The police have registered a case to trace the threat source. This follows last week's bomb threat at Taj West End Hotel and an August incident at a Whitefield mall.
title: Three Bengaluru engineering collages get bomb threat

description: The Supreme Court formed an independent SIT to investigate claims of animal fat use in Tirupati laddus. YSRCP's Jagan Mohan Reddy criticized CM Chandrababu Naidu for spreading false news. The court highlighted Naidu's remarks that hurt Hindu sentiments. The investigation will be overseen by the CBI Director.
title: Tirupati laddu case: SC has pointed out Naidu's 'true picture', says Jagan Mohan Reddy

description: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah has been temporarily buried in a secret location due to fears of Israeli attacks on mourners. After his death in an Israeli strike, the group sought guarantees from the US for a safe public funeral, but efforts were unsuccessful. Hezbollah has not yet named a successor, amid ongoing Israeli bombardments targeting key members.
title: Hezbollah's Nasrallah temporarily buried at secret location amid fear of ...

description: Security forces are engaged in an ongoing encounter with Naxalites in the Bastar region's Abhujmaad forest near the Chhattisgarh-Maharashtra border, Narayanpur district. A similar clash in Sukma district led to the discovery of a Naxalite camp with explosives seized. Updates are awaited.
title: Chhattisgarh: 7 Maoists killed in encounter in Bastar region

description: The Rock's return to WWE could be imminent, with fans speculating it may occur at Bad Blood 2024. Hints include Cody Rhodes and Roman Reigns headlining the event, cryptic conversations about a 'big guy' comeback, and The Rock's movie release next month, making his WWE appearance a prime promotional opportunity.
title: Is The Rock coming back? 3 signs that tell us the “Final Boss” will appear at Bad Blood

description: Former President Barack Obama will campaign for Vice President Kamala Harris in key battleground states ahead of the upcoming election, beginning in Pittsburgh. Obama has described Harris’s candidacy as a continuation of his political legacy, highlighting her focus on serving the American people. Their political alliance spans two decades, with Harris supporting Obama during his 2008 campaign. Polls show Harris holding a slight lead over Trump, with independent voters being unpredictable. Additionally, some Republicans may support Harris, as indicated by recent endorsements and polls showing a shift among Republican voters. The election remains highly competitive.
title: Bad news for Trump? Harris to get Obama boost in last 27 days of campaign

description: Amazon plans to cut around 14,000 managerial positions by early 2025 to increase operational efficiency and save up to $3.6 billion annually. This restructuring aligns with CEO Andy Jassy's goal to boost the ratio of individual contributors to managers by 15%, enhancing agility and decision-making.
title: Amazon could cut 14,000 managerial roles: ‘Now is the right time to …,’ says company

description: Himachal Pradesh CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu refutes claims of a 'toilet tax,' stating his government charges Rs 100 per family for water connection. Union minister Nirmala Sitharaman condemned the alleged tax. An official clarified the notification mentioning the tax was withdrawn upon deputy CM's disapproval, citing it covered sewerage charges based on water usage.
title: Did Himachal govt impose 'toilet tax'? Here's what CM Sukhu said

description: Afghan cricket star Rashid Khan married in a grand ceremony in Kabul, featuring armed security and a dazzling fireworks display. The event adhered to Pashtun customs and was attended by several Afghan cricket players. Rashid recently led Afghanistan to the semi-finals of the ICC T20 World Cup, marking a high point in his career.
title: Watch: Guns, firecrackers on display during Rashid's wedding

description: Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu is set to visit India from October 6-10 for his first bilateral trip. He will meet President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi to discuss bilateral and international issues. This visit follows his attendance at Modi's swearing-in ceremony in June.
title: In 1st bilateral visit, Maldives president Muizzu to visit India from Oct 6

description: MS Dhoni and Rohit Sharma are the most successful IPL captains with five titles each, but Rohit's Mumbai Indians have historically bested Dhoni's Chennai Super Kings in finals. Former cricketer Harbhajan Singh explains how MI consistently outperform CSK in crucial games and praises both captains for inspiring their teams to victory.
title: 'To overcome Dhoni's tactics...': Bhajji on how MI outperformed CSK

description: Ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Australian cricketers Steve Smith and Pat Cummins acknowledge India's challenge, emphasizing the importance of the series starting on November 22.  Smith respects India's dominance while skipper Cummins seeks to amend past defeats. Star spinner Nathan Lyon also praises the Indian squad, and said he has always loved to compete against the star-studded Indian line-up.
title: We know India are very difficult to beat, says Oz cricketer ahead of BGT

description: The Supreme Court has dismissed petitions seeking a review of its earlier judgment that confirmed states' constitutional power to create sub-categories within Scheduled Castes for reservation benefits. The seven-judge bench, led by Chief Justice D Y Chandrachud, found no error in the original ruling and denied open court hearings for the review petitions.
title: Supreme Court dismisses pleas seeking review of sub-classifications in SC reservation judgment

description: External affairs minister S Jaishankar will visit Pakistan for the SCO meeting on October 16 and 17. Pakistan invited Prime Minister Modi, but due to strained relations, Jaishankar will attend. The SCO, a major Eurasian grouping, allows members like India and Pakistan to cooperate despite bilateral disputes. The SCO is a Eurasian permanent intergovernmental international organisation created in June 2001 by Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Russia, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, India and China.
title: External affairs minister S Jaishankar to visit Pakistan for SCO summit

description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei defended Hamas' attacks on Israel as legal and accused the US and its allies of supporting Israel for energy interests. He vowed continued resistance in the Middle East and emphasized regional solidarity. Khamenei honored the late Sayyid Hassan Nasrallah, urging Hezbollah youth to continue his mission.
title: 'Israel will not last long': Iran Supreme Leader Khamenei's warning in rare sermon

description: Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi have offered condolences to the family of Sunil Kumar, a teacher murdered along with his wife and daughters in Uttar Pradesh. Authorities suspect a link to a previous complaint Poonam Bharti filed. Congressman Kishori Lal Sharma urges a comprehensive investigation.
title: Rahul Gandhi speaks to relative of family shot dead inside Amethi home

description: The Supreme Court reprimands Gujarat authorities over the demolition of nine religious structures near the Somnath temple, underscoring potential contempt for its order against bulldozer actions. The court hints at possible jail terms and restoration orders while seeking responses by October 16.
title: 'If found in contempt ... ': SC on bulldozer action in Gujarat

description: Air Chief Marshal AP Singh discussed the positive feedback on Agniveers, India's plan to have an entirely domestically-produced Air Force inventory by 2047, and the strengthening of air capabilities through new airfields and advanced weaponry like Kusha and Akash missiles, amid geopolitical strains.
title: India received three units of S-400 missile systems from Russia: IAF chief

description: Govinda has been discharged from the hospital on Friday afternoon after he hurt his leg with a bullet accidentally while cleaning his revolver. The actor was accompanied by his wife Sunita Ahuja and daughter Tina Ahuja as he greeted paps and thanked them for all their love!
title: Govinda gets discharged, greets paps and thanks fans for all the love

description: A viral video showed an ant inside a laptop screen, igniting online debates. User Aditya's video garnered over 4 lakh views. Some users suspected manufacturing defects, while others shared similar experiences and concerns about potential damage to laptop components.
title: User posts video of ant crawling inside laptop screen; gets this reply

description: The Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Test series between India and Australia, has equaled the prestige of The Ashes, marked by intense competition since 1996. India edge out Australia overall, winning 24 of 56 matches. Dominance at home has been key, with India claiming 18 of 29 home games. India have won 10 of the 16 series so far.
title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: A brief history in numbers

description: The National Medical Commission's (NMC) new mandate requires all postgraduate (PG) medical institutions in India to submit an Annual Self-Declaration Report as per the PGMEB-2023 guidelines. This directive aims to ensure accountability, transparency, and adherence to educational standards. It impacts medical colleges, students, and the healthcare system by focusing on quality improvement and professional ethics. While it promises to enhance medical education, challenges like compliance and resource management could arise.
title: How NMC's self-declaration requirement will affect PG medical education in India

description: The Supreme Court has mandated the formation of an independent Special Investigative Team to probe allegations of animal fat in Tirupati temple laddus. The new SIT will include members from FSSAI, CBI, and Andhra Pradesh police to ensure impartiality. This decision underscores the importance of maintaining the sanctity of religious sentiments linked to the prasadam.
title: 'Sentiments of crores involved': What SC said on Tirupati laddu row

description: Abhimanyu Easwaran's resilient innings of 191 for Rest of India in the 2024 Irani Cup ended just nine runs short of a double century, alongside Dhruv Jurel's 93. Their efforts helped recover from early wickets but Mumbai's bowlers eventually turned the tide, dismissing Rest of India for 416. Mulani and Kotian continued their fine bowling, each taking three wickets as Rest of India were bowled out for 416, giving Mumbai a crucial upper hand in the match.
title: Abhimanyu Easwaran misses out on a double century

description: Tribal MLAs, including Deputy Speaker Narhari Zirwal, protested in Mantralaya against the suspension of Scheduled Tribe candidate appointments under PESA and the inclusion of Dhangars in the ST list. They demanded immediate recruitment and opposed the government's lack of response. CM Eknath Shinde plans to meet the MLAs to address their concerns.
title: Maharashtra deputy speaker jumps off 3rd floor of Mantralaya building
'What happens to democracy if you interfere like this': SC questions Delhi LG

description: Nithin Kamath's comment on Indians' dislike for the wealthy sparked debate. Harsh Goenka countered, asserting that Indians admire billionaires like Ratan Tata for their philanthropy and values, while criticizing those who flaunt wealth and prioritize personal gain. The discussion drew varied reactions, highlighting the importance of responsible wealth usage in Indian society.
title: Harsh Goenka on Nithin Kamath's take on 'Indians hating rich people'

description: Indian Railways is set to launch its first hydrogen train, with trial runs expected in December 2024. The project includes 35 trains and significant investments in ground infrastructure.
title: Indian Railways’ 1st hydrogen train on tracks soon?
Indian-American professor Shailaja Paik receives US Genius Grant

description: Arvind Kejriwal has moved from his previous residence to a new official bungalow on Feroz Shah Road in Delhi. This change comes after he stepped down as Delhi's chief minister. The AAP supremo's family headed towards the official residence of party member Ashok Mittal at Feroz Shah Road in a car accompanied by his parents, wife, and two children.
title: Kejriwal leaves CM residence, moves to AAP MP's bungalow

description: Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan claims the Tirupati laddu adulteration issue is just the beginning, pointing to further wrongdoings by the previous regime. He emphasizes the need for a thorough investigation and urges the judiciary to consider corruption charges against YS Jagan Mohan Reddy. Kalyan also advocates for protecting Sanatana Dharma through national legislation.
title: To all pseudo secularists, I am an unapologetic Hindu: Pawan Kalyan

description: An Air India Express flight destined for Muscat returned to Thiruvananthapuram Airport after suspected smoke was noticed during take-off initiation. The incident, which occurred around 10.30 am, led to 142 passengers being offloaded for inspection. The airline arranged an alternative aircraft and announced an investigation while emphasizing passenger safety.
title: Muscat-bound Air India Express flight returns to Kerala after smoke alert

description: A 50-year-old Unani doctor, Javed Akhtar, was shot dead inside his cabin at Nima Hospital, South Delhi. Police detained a suspect who claimed he was hired by the husband of a nurse for the crime. The minor suspect's motives involved a promised marriage with the nurse's daughter. Investigation is ongoing.
title: 'You can marry our daughter if you kill doctor': Chilling details from Delhi hospital

description: Israeli warplanes carried out severe airstrikes on Wednesday night targeting Hashem Safieddine, a senior Hezbollah member and cousin of the recently assassinated Hassan Nasrallah. It is unclear whether Safieddine was killed. Safieddine has been a central figure in Hezbollah with strong ties to Iran.
title: Who is Hashem Safieddine, targetted by Israel airstrikes?

description: Former US President Donald Trump praised vice-presidential candidate JD Vance for his strong performance in the debate against Tim Walz. Trump claimed Vance outperformed his opponent, noting that post-debate polls showed Vance with a slight edge. Both candidates saw increased favorability ratings.
title: ‘I drafted the best ... ’: Trump reacts to Vance-Walz VP debate

description: The Indian women’s cricket team, led by Harmanpreet Kaur, is set to compete in the ICC T20 World Cup. Facing New Zealand in their opening match, India aims for their maiden trophy with seasoned players and a strong spin attack poised to shine in Dubai.
title: India resume quest for maiden World Cup trophy vs NZ

description: In Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur district, a tragic accident involving a truck and a tractor-trolley claimed ten lives and injured three others. The collision occurred on GT Road around 1 am as laborers were returning from construction work. The injured were taken to IIT-BHU hospital and are stable. Police have registered a case and investigations are ongoing.
title: 10 killed, 3 injured as truck hits tractor-trolley in UP's Mirzapur

description: The WHO has urgently approved Abbott Laboratories' mpox diagnostic test amid rising global cases. The Alinity m MPXV assay detects the virus from skin lesion swabs, aiding rapid testing in outbreak regions. It marks a crucial step in controlling the spread, especially in underserved areas. Vulnerable groups, including children and those with weakened immune systems, face higher risks.
title: World’s first mpox diagnostic test approved by WHO; know all about it

description: A Fox weather anchor became emotional during a live broadcast as Jessica Turner recounted her 7-year-old son Micah's final moments during Hurricane Helene in Asheville, North Carolina, where he cried out to Jesus. The article also mentions a South Carolina couple who died when a tree fell on their home.
title: TV anchor chokes up on-air as mother shares story of son lost to hurricane Helene

description: Palak Sindhwani is out of Taarak Mehta now. She has been replaced by Khushi Mali, a model-turned-actress.
title: Exclusive! Taarak Mehta has a new Sonu, Khushi Mali replaces Palak Sindhwani
Watch: Yazidi girl kidnapped by ISIS at 11, rescued from Gaza after a decade

description: US President Joe Biden appeared momentarily confused when asked about Hurricane Helene during his visit to storm-hit regions. Helene has left over 210 dead, making it the second-deadliest storm to hit the US in 50 years. Biden assured residents of ongoing federal aid during his tours of affected states, highlighting the climate change crisis.
title: Watch: Another gaffe? Biden appears confused when asked about storm zone

description: India's Women’s T20 World Cup campaign kicks off against New Zealand on October 4, with skipper Harmanpreet Kaur under pressure to lead her team to a strong start. Focusing on overcoming past failures, India relies on its spin-heavy attack and senior players to counter New Zealand’s experienced squad.
title: Women's T20 WC match today INDW vs NZW: Dream11 team prediction, match details

description: Walking for forty minutes daily is a low-impact, accessible workout suitable for all ages that strengthens the heart, aids weight loss, and reduces stress. This routine exercise can improve heart health, lower blood pressure, enhance mental well-being, and contribute to longevity, with benefits including better circulation, reduced depression, and decreased risk of chronic diseases.
title: Why walking for 40 minutes daily might be the best workout?

description: Rajinikanth underwent a successful non-surgical procedure to treat a swelling in his aorta, performed by Dr. Sai Satish. He is stable and expected to be discharged in two days. Rajinikanth will resume work on his film 'Coolie' after a few weeks' rest. His upcoming film 'Vettaiyan' is set for release on October 10.
title: Rajinikanth discharged from hospital after a heart surgery

description: Four months after Rohit Sharma led India to ICC T20 World Cup glory, the women’s team, captained by Harmanpreet Kaur, hopes to emulate his success in the Women's T20 World Cup. Starting their campaign against New Zealand, India aims to move past past disappointments and secure their maiden title. Harmanpreet emphasizes her team's preparedness and positive approach.
title: Harmanpreet Kaur aims to emulate Rohit Sharma

description: Naga Chaitanya and Samantha Ruth Prabhu's divorce has sparked significant controversy, especially following Telangana Minister Konda Surekha's recent remarks linking their separation to political figures. The couple, who parted ways in 2021 after four years of marriage asserted their split was mutual. In response to the minister's statements, both actors have emphasized the need for privacy and respect regarding their personal lives.
title: Naga Chaitanya and Samantha's divorce: Minister’s claims spark controversy

description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has become the world's second-richest person, surpassing Jeff Bezos with a net worth of $206.2 billion. His wealth increased by $78 billion in 2024, driven by a 70% surge in Meta's shares. The company's recovery strategy and ongoing investments in AI and augmented reality have bolstered investor confidence.
title: Mark Zuckerberg becomes 2nd richest person, surpasses Jeff Bezos

description: Bill Gates has dropped to No. 9 in America's wealth rankings, impacted mainly by his 2021 divorce from Melinda French Gates, who now ranks among the wealthiest women at $29 billion. Gates remains focused on philanthropy through his foundation, despite the decrease in his net worth.
title: Bill Gates out of world’s top 10 richest list for first time in 20-plus years

description: Despite Virat Kohli not securing an ICC trophy during his captaincy, former India spinner Harbhajan Singh asserts that Kohli ignited a fighting spirit in the Indian cricket team. The examples he cited were from the resilient performances in the 2020-21 tour of Australia, particularly in the third and the fourth Test, demonstrating the legacy Kohli left behind.
title: 'Jo Virat Kohli ne aag lagayi...' - Harbhajan Singh

description: A 21-year-old woman was allegedly raped by three men in the Bopdev Ghar area near Pune late Thursday night. Her male companion was assaulted. Pune police have set up ten teams to investigate the case. The incident occurred in an isolated location, making it challenging to identify the suspects.
title: Woman gang-raped by three men near Pune, her male friend assaulted

description: Vistara has outlined five essential steps for passengers with flights on or after Nov 12, 2024, when it merges with Air India. Passengers need to verify their bookings, understand PNR and e-ticket changes, stay informed about flight operations, review baggage allowances, and manage rescheduling or cancellations.
title: Vistara issues ‘five essential’ steps for flyers after merger with AI

description: Hindu American groups flew a banner in New York urging to 'stop violence on Bangladeshi Hindus' amid recent targeted attacks following political upheaval in Bangladesh. Activists highlight the plight of up to 200,000 Hindus affected by violence, calling for UN intervention to recognize the 1971 Bangladesh genocide officially.
title: 'Stop violence on Bangladeshi Hindus': Airline banner floats in New York

description: The Indian women's cricket team, led by Harmanpreet Kaur, will commence their ICC Women's T20 World Cup campaign against New Zealand. India have been strong contenders in recent years, while New Zealand's form has declined, winning only one of their 13 T20Is in 2024.
title: IND vs NZ at Women's T20 WC: What do numbers say about the rivalry

description: Venkata Krishna, a 57-year-old software consultant, transformed his health after the sudden death of a close friend. Battling obesity and diabetes, he sought professional help, changed his diet, incorporated more physical activity, and successfully lowered his medication. His journey emphasizes the importance of consistent effort and healthier lifestyle choices to regain control over one's health.
title: Weight Loss Story: 57-year old software engineer loses 20 kgs by following this routine

description: After making around Rs 21 crore on Wednesday which was a holiday due to Gandhi Jayanti, 'Devara: Part 1' has dropped to Rs 7 crore on Thursday. The film has now completed a run of one week at the Pan India box office!
title: 'Devara Part 1' box office collection day 7: Movie sees major drop

description: Babar Azam resigned as Pakistan's white-ball captain. Rashid Latif supports the move, believing it will improve Babar's batting. Latif suggests new captaincy candidates, advocating for leadership qualities reminiscent of Imran Khan and Younus Khan. He anticipates a new leader emerging for Pakistan after the Champions Trophy scheduled for early next year.
title: Bold prediction! 'Ab Babar Azam ka time aayega'

description: Three coaches of a goods train derailed in Ratlam, Madhya Pradesh, affecting the Delhi-Mumbai route. The train was traveling from Rajkot to Bakaniya. Divisional Railway Manager Rajneesh Kumar stated that two of the coaches had minor issues while one has already been lifted. The investigation continues, with no trains being canceled, only delayed.
title: 3 coaches of goods train derail in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam

description: Rishabh Pant, known for his ever-present smile and sense of humour, celebrates his 27th birthday. He made a remarkable comeback after a year-long hiatus due to a car accident, scoring his sixth Test century against Bangladesh and securing his place as India's first-choice wicketkeeper-batsman ahead of the Border Gavaskar Trophy.
title: 'Gabba conqueror' Rishabh Pant celebrates 27th birthday

description: In Kanpur, a couple named Rajeev and Rashmi Dubey allegedly defrauded over two dozen couples of Rs 35 crore, claimings their 'oxygen therapy' offered by a fake 'Israel-made time machine' could make clients look 25 again. Police are investigating and searching for the duo.
title: How 'Israel-made time machine' scam to turn people young made Rs 35 crore vanish

description: A government school teacher, his wife, and their two daughters were shot dead by an attacker in Amethi. The motive is unclear, and the incident appears not to be a robbery. Police suspect a vendetta might be behind the crime. Investigations are ongoing with forensic teams and dog squads gathering evidence.
title: Amethi horror: Man barges into home, kills teacher, wife, 2 daughters
